fn read_file
(
path : & str
) ->
io :: Result
<
Vec
< u8 >
>
{ let contents :
Vec
< u8 >
=
fs :: read
( path )
? ;
Ok
( contents )
}
source_file.line_comment: // Print error messages to stderr before exiting so programs calling this cli can detect it easily
source_file.function_item:
fn node_to_json
(
node :
tree_sitter :: Node
,
cursor : & mut
tree_sitter :: TreeCursor
,
source_code : & [ u8 ]
,) ->
serde_json :: Value
{ let mut
children =
Vec :: new
()
;
if
cursor . goto_first_child
()
{
loop {
children . push
(
node_to_json
(
cursor . node
()
, cursor , source_code )
)
;
if !
cursor . goto_next_sibling
()
{
break ; }
}
cursor . goto_parent
()
; }
let mut
map =
serde_json :: Map
:: new
()
;
map . insert
(
"" . to_string
()
,
json ! ( node
kind
() )
)
;
if let
Some ( field_name ) =
cursor . field_name
()
{
map . insert
(
"" . to_string
()
,
json ! ( field_name )
)
; }
let start =
node . start_position
()
;
let end =
node . end_position
()
;
map . insert
(
"" . to_string
()
,
json ! ( { ""
start
row
""
start
column } )
,)
;
map . insert
(
"" . to_string
()
,
json ! ( { ""
end
row
""
end
column } )
,)
;
map . insert
(
"" . to_string
()
,
json ! ( children )
)
;
map . insert
(
"" . to_string
()
,
json ! ( std
str
from_utf8
( source_code
[ node
start_byte
()
node
end_byte
() ] )
unwrap_or
( "" ) )
,)
;
// We can add more fields here based on the node type, for example:
if
node . kind
()
== ""
{
map . insert
(
"" . to_string
()
,
json ! ( "" )
)
; }
serde_json :: Value
:: Object
( map )
}
